title: Amazon KDP Keyword Research Guide That Actually Helps (Find $10k/Mth Book Topics)

tactics.name: bsr_review_analysis
tactics.description: Identify profitable book topics by analyzing bestseller rank and review counts of existing books
steps: Filter books with high BSR and review counts
Create a focused book for a specific search term
caveats: Requires niche specificity to avoid competition
source_quotes: we're going to be finding a profitable book topic or keyword we're then going to create a book for that main search term

tactics.name: Deep Click Method
tactics.description: Navigate Amazon categories, click into books, and explore recommended titles to uncover untapped topics
steps: Use private browsing with US zip code
Click into books to access deeper recommendations
Record unique topics from product pages
source_quotes: If you're only spending an hour on keyword research it's most likely that other people are also spending an hour or two doing it and so they're just going to find all the same stuff that you are

tactics.name: Deep Category Clicking
tactics.description: Explore hidden book topics by clicking into underexposed categories and books to uncover niche topics with lower competition.
steps: Click into books within categories to identify related subtopics
Record topics from books with low review counts and high bestseller ranks
Use Book Beam's Niche Finder to filter by BSR and review parameters
caveats: May fail if niche saturation is high
source_quotes: People are only finding these if they're doing the same thing... not just on surface level categories

tactics.name: Keyword Validation
tactics.description: Validate keywords by analyzing search volume, BSR, review counts, and topic saturation
steps: Check search volume and BSR thresholds
Assess topic saturation by page depth
caveats: Trademark terms like 'good energy' may limit viability
source_quotes: we want to make sure the topics...are all the same

heuristics.name: low_review_boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with low competition
source_quotes: we're going to be finding a profitable book topic or keyword we're then going to create a book for that main search term

heuristics.name: Low Review Signal
source_quotes: Finding book topics that are untapped with low competition is more difficult

heuristics.name: Winning Book Ratio
heuristics.condition: If low review books outnumber dead books, prioritize the keyword
source_quotes: Books with low reviews are selling... if there's a lot of books with low reviews selling it must mean the demand is high

heuristics.name: Dead Book Indicator
heuristics.condition: If low review counts dominate search results, the niche is undersaturated
source_quotes: lots of books that have low reviews...selling well

claims.statement: Amazon KDP is not oversaturated due to persistent demand for specific niches
source_quotes: Amazon KDP is not oversaturated it doesn't make any sense there's always people looking for something

claims.statement: Amazon KDP requires 1-3 weeks of keyword research to find profitable niches
source_quotes: Don't be afraid to spend a few weeks doing this because the keyword is the most important part of the publishing process

claims.statement: The spreadsheet metrics accurately predict keyword viability by analyzing traffic, demand, and competition
source_quotes: The spreadsheet is very accurate in determining if a keyword is good or not

claims.statement: Diet cookbooks often experience seasonal traffic dips before Christmas
source_quotes: diet cookbooks often die off before Christmas

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identities with targeted problems and unique constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Leverages low review counts and high demand for niche solutions
source_quotes: we're going to be finding a profitable book topic or keyword we're then going to create a book for that main search term
